cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 59 (Monday, April 3, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. GREEN of Tennessee:H.R. 2464.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article One, Section 8, Clause 14The single subject of this legislation is:To direct the Commander of United States Army SpecialOperations Command to seek to carry out a training programwith special operations forces of the Polish Army.[Page H1699]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

cdata.text:
General Thaddeus Kosciuszko Memorial Exchange Program for Polish-American Defense Cooperation Act

This bill requires the U.S. Army Special Operations Command to seek to carry out a training program between its special operations forces and the special forces of the Polish Army, to be known as the General Thaddeus Kosciuszko Memorial Exchange Program for Polish-American Defense Cooperation. Officers and enlisted members may participate the program.

bill.title: General Thaddeus Kosciuszko Memorial Exchange Program for Polish-American Defense Cooperation Act

item.title: General Thaddeus Kosciuszko Memorial Exchange Program for Polish-American Defense Cooperation Act
General Thaddeus Kosciuszko Memorial Exchange Program for Polish-American Defense Cooperation Act
To direct the Commander of United States Army Special Operations Command to seek to carry out a training program with special operations forces of the Polish Army.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
